runs.comm: pulls first ball. It stays a touch low, and runs off the lower half of the bat, past short fine leg. The length is not good
on a length, on the pads, flicked past short fine leg for a couple

and once again on the tour, Anwar Ali's slower ball has accounted for Perera. And not for the first time, Perera is out in the first over. Slower ball, on a length, on off, Perera tries for that Jayasuriya shot into the cow corner, and gets a massive top edge for mid-on to catch
his towel falls off as he releases, but that doesn't distract anybody. Length ball, pushed wide of mid-off for one

and he has got a dream start. Short and wide, at gentle pace, and he has square-cut it sweetly in front of point. Wasim seems to have got a hand to it inside the circle. That saves two runs for Pakistan
nice drive on the up as Anwar bowls a length ball outside off. Straight to mid-off. Two sweet connections first up for de Silva
on a length, the natural Tanvir angle and slight seam away, beats Dilshan's drive
short of a length, just around off, steered past point for one
short, around off, de Silva drops it into the leg side for one. Looks an organised batsman
looks for the ramp over fine leg as Tanvir bowls length outside off. He manages a thick outside edge over slip for four

Tanvir strikes too. The openers are back in the hut. Seam-up, short of a length, on off, seams away a touch, bounces too, gets a little big on the Dilshan drive, and takes the edge through to the keeper
length ball outside off, left alone
nice little push-drive on the up, but not past cover on the ring
slower ball, on a length outside off, pushed to mid-off for one
on a length, outside off, slugged to wide of mid-on for one
full outside off, driven straight to mid-off
nice little flick-chip to a slower ball on middle and leg. Gets a couple over midwicket
short of a length, hits him on the pad, but is pitched outside leg and goes for a leg-bye

Tanvir doesn't even realise he has bowled Vithanage. This is a wide half-volley, Vithanage goes for the drive, gets a massive inside edge, and lo the bails are off. Tanvir doesn't realise that, and raises his arms in disappointment. And then he breaks into a smile
short of a length, on the pads, worked away in front of deep backward square for two
short of a length, just outside off, stays back to defend
short of a length around off again, dropped towards cover for a single
on a length, just outside off, pushed to cover
slower ball, on a length, flicked away for one
short of a length, into the pads, tucked away for one
short of a length, just outside off, hits the sticker on the bat
slower legcutter, on a length, into the pads, uses soft hands to play it deep into the leg side, and steals a second
another legcutter, this time around off, and is defended to leg
drags it down with Mathews advancing at him. Mathews pulls it straight of deep midwicket, but Hafeez does well to keep them down to two
short of a length, at the stumps, Mathews makes room, pushes it towards cover for one
and he is taken to the cleaners first ball. Mathews charges at him, makes room, and drives a length ball over extra cover for four

gone. He is not, actually. The slower offcutter from Irfan seems to have taken the edge as Mathews defends outside off. There is a sound as the ball passes the bat, and Pakistan go up as one. Not given, and rightly so. There is daylight - sorry, flood light - between bat and ball
regulation pace, short, extra bounce, handcuffs him as he charges at Irfan
slower ball, on a length, pushed in front of point for one
looks to pull but is hurried up by Irfan's pace, and bottom-edges it back to the bowler
short of a length, outside off, runs it down to third man. Good comeback after being hit for four first ball
lovely shot. This is a tossed-up legbreak, on off. De Silva stays legside of the ball, and chips it over extra cover for a beautiful four
flighted outside off, deep cover is back now. Just the single
flatter, shorter, pushed to long-off for one
slider, just outside off, defended back to him
slower through the air, middle and leg, turning to off, flicked to long-on for one
shorter, flatter, punched to deep midwicket
short of a length, tucked away off the hip for one
short, outside off, and kicks off alarmingly to beat de Silva's attempt to ramp it over the cordon
short of a length, hits the thigh pad as the ball gets a little big. Concedes a leg-bye
bouncer, a sharp one, on middle and leg, head high. Beats the jab from Mathews. Asking rate goes over 10.5
Irfan is getting too big for these batsmen. Mathews looks to slog him, and the ball bounces to take a thick edge over mid-off. Mathews just swung and hoped for the best
short of a length, no room, defended back to him
down the wicket to meet this on the half-volley, takes a single to long-on
leaves the crease again, mis-hits this legbreak to long-on for one more
shimmies a little, Afridi fires this in, pushed to long-off for one
looks for the reverse sweep. Afridi bowls shorter. He plays the reverse pull. Straight to point. Asking rate crosses 11
short of a length, no room, pushed to cover for one
fired in again, cramps him again, and de Silva has hit this back to Afridi
big slog to a wide length ball, and connects thin air
makes room, Wasim follows him with a tight leg-stump line. Another dot as he hits this straight to extra cover
desperate slog across the line, wide of long-on, gets a couple

he has got the debutant with a deflection on a powerful straight hit. No he hasn't actually. Mathews has clobbered this back, Wasim claims he has got a hand to it as the ball hits the stumps and de Silva is well out of the crease backing up. The third umpire is asked to adjudicate. Wasim's appeal is instantaneous. The ball deviates as it crosses the hand, but the replay doesn't confirm beyond reasonable doubt that Wasim has got a hand to it. Not given out. They get a single off the deflection off the stumps
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep cover
there's the big fish. Mathews is getting more and more desperate every passing delivery. He slogs at a straight length ball, and the quicker ball crashes into the exposed middle stump
driven wide of long-off for two
pushed to deep cover for one
how has he not bowled him? This is full and straight, Siriwardana sweeps all over it, and it just nearly kisses the off stump
down the wicket, uses soft hands, places it between deep square and deep midwicket for a couple
tries the reverse sweep, mis-hits it to short third man for one. That is very unlike de Silva. He looks like a solid orthodox batsman. Should try him in longer formats
chipped to long-off for one. Asking rate crosses 12.5
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep cover for one
down the wicket, doesn't get any power behind the drive, gets a single to long-on
fires into the pads, too short, and there is pace on it. Siriwardana plays the pick-up pull, uses all the pace on the ball, and deposits it over deep square leg
driven to deep cover for one
down the wicket to drive this to long-off for one
beautiful shot. Sri Lanka finally getting some momentum. Siriwardana likes these darts. He gets one on a length with room to swing. And he just chips it over extra cover for four
down the wicket, no room, slugs it to deep midwicket for one
full, flighted into his zone, and Siriwardana gets under to loft it over wide long-on for a massive six. Not over yet, folks
even slower in the air, Siriwardana plays it with soft hands and places it between deep square and deep midwicket for two more
quicker one, outside off, steers it behind square for one
slow legbreak outside off, driven to deep cover for one
front-of-the-hand full delivery, driven to long-off for one. A very good over for Sri Lanka, but still doesn;t match the asking rate. That's how stiff the task is
non-spinning offbreak, dropped at his feet, and de Silva calls him through for a single
makes room to take this on the full and chips it wide of long-off for a couple

and de Silva opens up his arms only to mistime this to deep midwicket. De Silva looks a good player, but massive hits doesn't seem to be his game. Here he has no choice but to look for that massive hit. The wily Malik gives him little pace to work with. He sweeps hard, and finds deep midwicket with it
down the wicket, beaten in the flight, gets a thick inside edge on the slog. Takes the single

big stumping appeal first ball. Another offbreak that doesn't turn, and drags Kapu's back foot out as he defends and is beaten on the outside edge. But he gets the foot back in before Rizwan can break the wicket
oh Kapu. The vexing perplexing Kapu. What a clean strike second ball. Down the wicket, right to the pitch of the ball, and lofts it dead straight back over his head for a sumptuous six
lovely shot. This is short of a length, about chest high, Siriwardana makes room and cuts it in the air and in front of cover. Mukhtar makes a big dive from deep cover but can't get to it

length ball into the pads. The idea is to follow him as he backs away, but Siriwardana holds his shape long enough, and then clips it away behind square but in front of fine leg. A little gem so far from Siriwardana. The crowd has well and truly found its voice
full outside off, this time it is driven straight to deep cover
full outside off, driven to deep cover for one
Irfan gets lucky. Bowls a big full toss outside off, but Siriwardana can't hit it wide enough of Mukhtar in the deep on the off side. This is hit to deep point, but Mukhtar runs to his right to field

big big over for Sri Lanka. Kapu joins Siri in the party. This is a poor ball, though. A wide half-volley, a yorker gone wrong, and Kapu gets under it to place it over point and to the right of third man. Game is well and truly on in Colombo
wide full toss, would have been wide had Siri not reached out and made a soft touch for a single to deep point
pick-up pull to a short ball angling in, doesn't find the gap, gets just the single

and Tanvir and the run-rate pressure get him finally. This is not quite the yorker, but it is full enough to not be a half-volley. Siri can't afford to play it to its merit. He goes low to try to manufacture a loft down the ground, but doesn;t get the elevation and the power he wants. Long-on takes an easy catch, and barring Thisara Perera now it might be all over
slower ball from round the stumps, steered to third man for one
full and outside off, slower ball, pushed to extra cover who is cutting the single. That takes the asking rate past 14
slower ball, draws a mis-hit down the ground from Perera, but it has gone wide of long-on, and they will get two despite an accurate return to the wicketkeeper from Anwar Ali
regulation pace, wide, on a length, Kapu stays back and doesn't get close to it. Gets a single off the mis-hit to long-off
full and wide, just inside the tram line, and defeats Perera who is backing away. That is clever bowling. He knows Perera likes to back away and go cow corner
tries to slip another wide one in, but goes too far this time, and is wided

smart bowling. Anwar knows Perera by batting on off stump has limited his options to cow corner. And the last thing he wants is the bouncer. And he is not expecting it either because the fine leg is up. And he is late on the hook when it is actually bowled, and the top edge kisses the sky and settles with the keeper, Rizwan
yorker now, dug out to leg and Anwar rushes across to field it and keep them down to a dot
the first really bad ball of the over. On a length, regulation pace and into the pads. Kapu stands strong, and plays the pick-up over square leg for a six
slower short ball, dragged from outside off for a single to long-on
length ball wide outside off. Kapu doesn't move his feet, and misses out on a gift. Just swings inside its line
full toss, thigh high, gets too big on him, gets only a single to extra cover. Oh that too he turns down
another full toss, this time he chooses to take the single. To long-on
heavy ball. Short of a length, at off, Fernando opens the face, and is beaten as the ball holds its line
and he angles one in just short of a length. Fernando backs away and looks to hit it square on the off side. Beaten
and he bowls short again, and Fernando is beaten outside off again
wide length ball, he has sliced it, but it falls short of deep point
short of a length, angles in, beats the inside edge as Fernando looks to open the face. Yet to put bat on ball
finally he hits a ball and gets off the mark. The slower ball is a low fullie, and he manages to place it wide of long-on
lovely shot. Tanvir bowls length, angling in towards off, and he chips it wide of long-off for four. Maybe it's time they reverted to bowling short to Fernando
full toss, hits the splice, goes for a single to point

oh that's a beautiful hit. Tanvir bowls length again, angling in. Kapu stays in the crease, opens up the off side, and chips this over extra cover for a handsome six. Just an extension of the arms, really
fired in by Wasim. The dot as this played back to him means sixes off all the balls won't do it
fired in outside off, and beats him on  the late cut
another dart into the pads. Dot again. Ending this rapidly, is Wasim
fires in a low full toss. Defended back to him
tosses this up to tease him, gets the top edge on the big heave, but it doesn't carry to the man deep on the leg side
this is a wide down the leg side but Kapu gets a touch on it for a couple of runs fine of short fine leg
